column4: unbelievable ... is this laptop linux-proof or what ? ... usb booting 'test ubuntu' not working 'instal from usb' not working, install by Wubi.. not working :<
what kind of laptop?
^^ have you checked the checksum?
the checksum is a hash value that you compare for the iso you downloaded to a hash that is on the ubuntu site. It verifies the integrety of the iso
ok ill read bout it and get back to ya with result.
will it help if i tell you that i donwloaded 3 different types of ubuntu ? is it possible that all 3 are corrupted ?
not likely.. although if you put them to disc, possibly.. but disc and usb, very unlikely.... Just trying to eliminate possibilities
also bootable usb with ubuntu was working fine on different pc ;/
64 bit or 32?
i tried both
i've had install issues with 64 bit before as well as 32 bit.. but after trying several different options, usually one works lol....
when i boot up from usb i just let it do hes job, its counting down to default choice, its try ubuntu, after it get to 0 it just restart, and it go on and on and on
then perhaps try a different usb installer... try pendrive linux
http://www.pendrivelinux.com/
thanks for advices ill try with other loader
a piece of advice, if you use the pendrive installer, it will ask you to download the file again, unless you specify the exact name of the iso you already have..
i used other loder and something happened. it start to load up ubuntu unfortunately it stopped after some time last message is : no plug and play decie found.
maybe it's a bad flash or usb port???
i use that installer very frequently..
so what should i do ? :) im newbie ;)
try another port? format the drive? try another stick? read the instructions for the pendrive installer (although it's pretty straight forward)
maybe i should ask what is the OS you are trying to make these sticks on
try this app.. http://sites.google.com/site/shamurxboot/download
meh its not working ... i give up for now, gonna get some sleep. Thanks for your time thou :)
